newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea to delay state bonds issue till October.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea to delay state bonds issue till October.

text.p: South Korea's Finance and Economy Ministry said on Friday it has decided to delay 835 billion won worth of state bond issues until October.

The bonds, which have from maturities from one to seven years, were orginally scheduled to be issued on August 28 and September 21. "Given recently soaring interest rates, we have to issue the bonds with high rates. So we decided to delay the plan," said a ministry official.
Growing corporate money demand ahead of Chusok holidays, the Korean Thanksgiving, pushed the benchmark three-year corporate bond yields to a year high of 12.58 percent on Thursday.
Heavy spending is usual around Chusok, which falls between September 26 and 29 this year.
The official said interest rates traditionally fall after the national holiday.
South Korea has issued 5.38 trillion won worth of state bonds out of a total of 8.7 trillion won worth planned.
